item.title: Is this correct?
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Try this, it should be a little more forgiving in the long run.

[code]int[] randomItems = { 10723, 10724, 10725, 10726, 10727, 10728, 10735 };

//…

int selectedItem = randomItems[Misc.random(randomItems.length)];

c.getItems().addItem(selectedItem, 1);[/code]

item.title: Is this correct?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

Before I start it in wanna know if this is the right way to do it.
When someone clicks on something I want them to get a random item out of an int. So here it is:

if(item == somenumber) {
int giveGear = Misc.random(6);
c.getItems().deleteItem(somenumber, howmany);
giveGear = Misc.random(6);
if(giveGear == 0) {
c.getItems().addItem(10723,1);
} else if (giveGear == 1) {
c.getItems().addItem(10724,1);
} else if (giveGear == 2) {
c.getItems().addItem(10725,1);
} else if (giveGear == 3) {
c.getItems().addItem(10726,1);
} else if (giveGear == 4) {
c.getItems().addItem(10727,1);
} else if (giveGear == 5) {
c.getItems().addItem(10728,1);
} else if (giveGear == 6) {
c.getItems().addItem(10735,1);
}

Whatchya think?

Read full topic
